intro: Argemone cambrica, commonly known as the common argemone, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its roots and seeds contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
